name: Wright Flyer
description: The first successful powered aircraft, made the first controlled, sustained flight on December 17, 1903.

name: Curtiss JN-4 "Jenny"
description: Widely used as a trainer aircraft during WWI and later for barnstorming in the 1920s.

name: Spirit of St. Louis
description: Custom-built for Charles Lindbergh’s solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic.

name: Supermarine Spitfire
description: Iconic British fighter of WWII with elliptical wings and superb maneuverability.
notes: Key role in Battle of Britain

name: Boeing B-17 Flying Fortress
description: Heavy bomber known for durability and long-range missions over Europe.

name: Bell X-1
description: First aircraft to break the sound barrier in level flight, piloted by Chuck Yeager.

name: Boeing 707
description: First successful commercial jet airliner, ushered in the Jet Age for passengers.

name: Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird
description: High-altitude, long-range reconnaissance aircraft; fastest air-breathing manned aircraft.

name: Airbus A380
description: World’s largest passenger airliner with double-deck cabin layout.

name: F-35 Lightning II
description: Stealth multirole combat aircraft with advanced sensors and vertical takeoff capability (B variant).

name: Boeing 787 Dreamliner
description: Fuel-efficient composite-body jetliner with advanced aerodynamics and passenger comfort.

name: Joby eVTOL
description: Prototype all-electric vertical takeoff and landing air taxi for urban mobility.
notes: Represents the rise of electric air taxis
